name: Hotel La Jolla, a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel WILL BE great when fully renovated and they get their act together. This was the first time I've bid on a hotel room and didn't feel I got my money's worth.
reviews.title: Will be nice, eventually, but avoid until the renovation is done.

reviews.text: The WiFi and gym (two of three amenities touted in their advertising) were both inoperable. With no business center or internet, we had no options for getting online to plan each day in an unfamiliar city.
reviews.title: They kicked our Wedding party out 2 weeks before!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The thermostats were indecipherable. Aside from being in Celsius instead of Farenheit, they were some sort of fancy programmable thermostat with no instructions, save for some icons that might as well have been heiroglyphics. Someone from maintenance, who admitted he didn't fully understand how the thermostat worked, showed us how to at least move a few numbers up and down to adjust the air.
reviews.title: Poor Service - Overbooked hotel and sent us to the Sheraton with no warning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our parking fee was waived since the internet wasn't working, but I don't see how they can charge $15 a day when I would guess more than half the rooms are still being renovated. The renovated rooms are nicely decorated with modern furnishings and fixtures. Still a few things left undone in the room -- masking tape behind the TV, exposed plumbing in the bathroom -- but overall very nice and comfortable. Elevators are trashed from construction traffic. No lobby or common areas to speak of, except for a tiny front desk. The restaurant on the top floor looks nice, but we didn't eat there (too exorbitant).
reviews.title: Don't Ever Stay Here!!

reviews.text: The rest of the stay was fairly pleasant, except for the lack of maid service on our first full day. It will eventually be a good place to stay, but until the renovations are complete, not nearly worthy of its rate or star rating.
reviews.title: Unbelievably Poor Customer Service- Limited sleep per heavy construction, pounding, and power tools

reviews.text: Good location, about 10 min walk to the nearest beach. About 15 minute walk to the La Jolla village center. Rooms were clean and comfortable but not fancy. Staff was friendly.
reviews.title: A great value in beautiful La Jolla

reviews.text: Great ocean views on the higher floors. If you dont want to pay the extra for a high-floor room, you can still visit the restaurant on the top floor. Go up at sunset for a glass of wine and appetizers!
reviews.title: Great Vacation Location

reviews.text: Our stay at Hotel La Jolla was great. We had a ground floor room. We did not hear the construction noises that other reviewers complained about. If we were outside they were pretty loud, but our room was below the noise. The room was cleaned each day and our requests for extra pillows and blankets were fulfilled ASAP. The maid even started leaving extra towels after the first day after seeing there were three of us in the room.
reviews.title: Go in with low expectations...

likes.liked: — Pool and hot tub were small but nice. Location is great.

reviews.text: The front desk staff was helpful and if they didn't know the answer they found one for me. The recommendations they made for dinner was on spot and they were quite helpful with directions. Just don't ask for a pencil to do homework with a 1st grader. They don't have any.
reviews.title: Good people, good value

likes.liked: — close to the beach, value, pool

reviews.title: Unimpressed
reviews.text: The pool was small, but enjoyable. Considering we're from the Northeast and we were swimming outside in February we were quite impressed.

My best friend and I drove up to La Jolla for one last mini vacation before school started. We loved Hotel La Jolla because of it's location. The lady that checked us in was so friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We had a room with a great view and the hotel was not too far from the beach. There was pleanty to do within a short distance of the hotel. We loved being able to work out and also sun bathe at pool site. Our room was kept exceptionally clean every day. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was very pleasant which made us feel welcome!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay At Hotel La Jolla

reviews.text: Our stay at Hotel La Jolla was amazing. I was hesitant to stay at an older hotel but, I was pleasantly surprised at how the staff was so accomodating. I was at the hotel while my husband had meetings to attend. I mentioned to the front desk clerk that I would like to rent a car so that I could go to the movie theatre. The hotel manager over heard my conversation and to my surprise he quickly made arrangements for the shuttle driver to drive me to the movie theatre! I felt like I was really appreciated and it also made me feel like someone was looking after me. The hotel's location is great in the evenings we were able to have a delicious dinner while enjoing a breath taking view. They have a small fitness center with some great equipment. The pool area is great place to bask in the sun. We will definitely return to this hotel because of the attention we received from the staff.
reviews.title: Sun & Fun At Hotel La Jolla

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and great restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights Aug 1-3 and had booked thru the hotel website. We paid for an ocean view room and boy did we get it! We checked in early (1:00) and asked specifically for a room on floors 7-9....we got one on the 8th floor and the view was spectacular. What we liked about it over maybe one of the hotels directly on the beach (like The Shores at La Jolla) was that it gives a panoamic view of La Jolla, including the ocean. One of the most beautiful things about La Jolla is the actual town and hills so we felt like we got the best of both worlds. The room was extremely clean, large, comfortable and lovely. Not contemporary, but lovely. They are actually going to undergo a renovation to contemporary in the fall. The staff was friendly and helpful. Loved the free shuttle service. We did not hear the outside traffic from our room, unless we were outside on the balcony.
reviews.title: A Real Gem

likes.disliked: — Walking distance to the beach....and the beach that was there waiting

reviews.text: We are beach people - primarily Mexican carribean (Riviera Maya, Cozumel, etc) so have pretty high beach standards. If you are looking for a pristine white beach don't go to The Shores beach, which is walking distance from the hotel (also where The Shores La Jolla hotel is). It was a very crowded, hard-packed sand beach. Apparently the tide pretty much comes all the way up at night so its really just not that pretty or comfortable. Though there are some nice little outdoor restaurants/cafes down there. Instead of trying one of the other La Jolla beaches (which the shuttle would take you to), we actually went over to Coronado for our second day. A great choice. I heard WindAndSea beach was better. We just decided we wanted to see the world-famous Coronado and also one of the local shop owners suggested we would like it better.
reviews.title: Relaxing at Hotel La Jolla

likes.liked: — The comfort of the bed and size of hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note - the hotel has free beach chairs to use.....get one as you will want one. They also offer free towels - they are small so get about 3 per person.
reviews.title: Awesome Experience

reviews.text: I cut short my planned four day stay at the Hotel La Jolla at the Shores. My room was in the renovated half of the hotel. The other half was in the full swing of construction with furniture and building materials stacked in the halls. Only one (slow) elevator was available to guests; the other dedicated to the workers.
reviews.title: Wait Until the Renovation is Finished

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was fully renovated with a great view of the ocean. It still smelled strongly from paint and chemicals. At least everything worked and the bed was comfortable. The Internet connection was very slow.
reviews.title: Maybe after the remodel

reviews.text: I was not impressed with the piles of debris around the building nor the RV's parked in the parking lot. Neither was I impressed with the receptionist who did know the way to anything.
reviews.title: My clients and I were extremely satisfied with our stay at the Hotel La Jolla

reviews.text: While the views are commanding, the hotel is located next to a large, noisy service station and, more importantly, overlooks a very noisy four lane highway.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stary at Hotel La Jolla at the Shores
HORRIBLE!!!! THINGS STOLEN OUT OF ROOM! HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!
reviews.text: The hotel is located next to a number of run down apartments and is far from anything except the freeway.

description: Boutique hotel with upscale decor and high end bedding and amenities. All non-smoking rooms, glass balconies, small gym, heated pool, walking distance to beach and La Jolla Shores shops and restaurants.
